meaning: occurring at irregular intervals or only in a few places; scattered or isolated.
(in Christian tradition) marks corresponding to those left on Christ's body by the Crucifixion, said to have been impressed by divine favour on the bodies of St Francis of Assisi and others.
a mark of disgrace associated with a particular circumstance, quality, or person.
supply a very ungenerous or inadequate amount of (something).
a person's fixed or allotted period of work.
limitation of supply or effort.
(of a leaf or plant) having stipules.
demand or specify (a requirement), typically as part of an agreement.
calm, dependable, and showing little emotion or animation.
marked with striae.
a writ ordering a person to attend a court.
become less intense, violent, or severe.
(of water) go down to a lower or the normal level.
provide evidence to support or prove the truth of.
take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use); supplant.
a belief held without proof or certain knowledge; an assumption or hypothesis.
understood or implied without being stated.
relating to or along a tangent.
diverging from a previous course or line; erratic.
very weak or slight.
a long, angry speech of criticism or accusation.
a rod or bar forming part of a framework and designed to resist compression.
a state of physical or mental inactivity; lethargy.
